Articles.Content:
Put them at a 45 degree angle for now, I\'ll fix them in 0.85 soonish.

Oh, alright then.

Good point. To hell with the engine expansion pack!

Aye that\'s a good idea. Less is more, especially when playing with this pack. The double length 1m was a welcome addition, and I wouldn\'t stop you from making a longer 2m tank to help those of us with shitty work PCs. Functionally though, this pack has everything it needs as it is.

Also: Props.
Thank you Nova, you are a wonderful human being!
It seems to me that in the 0.8 download there are no adv. sas and unmanned control module included.
It\'s not just you.
Accidental. I had changed attributes from them and deleted them with the intention of replacing them with the ones from 0.7, but I forgot.
There\'s also a second service module that went missing in the last update-or was that deliberate?

There\'s also a second service module that went missing in the last update-or was that deliberate?

That was deliberate, that thing was ugly as shit, and pointless.

That was deliberate, that thing was ugly as shit, and pointless.

Ahh.. the age old question has been answered. I was also wondering what happened to it.

Ahh.. the age old question has been answered. I was also wondering what happened to it.

age old? the updates only been out for 12 hours

age old? the updates only been out for 12 hours

No, I meant the service module. That\'s been out for quite a while.
0.9 is going to be mostly about improving the looks of the pack and doing some final tweaks. There\'s quite a few models and textures that need a bit of work.

0.9 is going to be mostly about improving the looks of the pack and doing some final tweaks. There\'s quite a few models and textures that need a bit of work.

If you ask me Nova, the pack is already amazing and looks great. Thanks for your countless amounts of hard work for the community. Your pack makes me feel like I\'m playing the in the future of KSP.

Tweaked liquid engines 1 and 5 (now both have the same Isp rating, overall efficiency increased slightly for both)

hello all,

i am a little curious - just to know what is wrong in my thinking...

thus the question:

how is it that efficiency increased, when for both engines the Isp (which is the efficiency of engines) is lower than it was in the previous version?

hello all,

i am a little curious - just to know what is wrong in my thinking...

thus the question:

how is it that efficiency increased, when for both engines the Isp (which is the efficiency of engines) is lower than it was in the previous version?

The Isp is 265s now, up from 255s. I forget what liquidengine5 was before though.
Why does everything wobble? even short rockets, the couplers just enjoy acting like hinges.

Why does everything wobble? even short rockets, the couplers just enjoy acting like hinges.

It\'s not something I really can fix... it\'s how the game handles decouplers. They\'re separate physical objects.
So what do the science kits do?

So what do the science kits do?

Make you feel good about flying for Science.

You can reinforce wobbly joints with struts spanning to the parts on either side of the problem decoupler. I\'ve never seen them not break away when the decoupler was activated, and the resulting rocket is much less flaccid..

Make you feel good about flying for Science.

So they just add weight?

So they just add weight?

Yes.
0.9 should be ready today... I hope.

Have some 0.9:

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/575558/KSP%20Silisko%20Edition%200.9.zip

http://www./?0eqcuxmsx931ngy

Changelog:

New textures for all fuel tanks

New texture for solidbooster 2

All solid boosters tweaked slightly

Added small decoupler shroud (1m, leaves an interstage ring attached to the upper stage)

Tried to make parachute textures better, failed
